name: Livedocs
headline: No-code analytics tool for modern teams
description: Livedocs is a no-code analytics tool for modern teams. We are building a document editor that helps non-technical operators build reports with live data from tools like Stripe, Google Analytics, Segment without writing code.

founders.name: Arsalan Bashir, Founder
founders.description: Founder of Livedocs (https://livedocs.com), engineer, love software, guerilla marketing (for the web), hiking, and Liverpool FC.

generated_description:
**Company Summary: Livedocs**

**Overview:**  
Founded in 2020 and part of Y Combinator’s W22 batch, Livedocs is redefining how modern teams manage data with its no-code analytics tool. Based in San Francisco, the company operates with a small team of three and aims to empower non-technical users to craft insightful reports from live data without the need for coding. 

**Mission:**  
Livedocs is on a quest to democratize data analytics—bridging the gap between complexity and accessibility—by enabling users to seamlessly integrate, visualize, and share data insights across popular platforms like Stripe, Google Analytics, and Segment.

**Core Product:**  
Livedocs offers a document editor that functions as a dynamic notebook for data storytelling. Users can mix Python, SQL, charts, and text in a collaborative environment. The platform supports real-time collaboration, allowing teams to explore and present data effectively without prior coding experience. The software emphasizes raw simplicity—start building for free, no credit card required.

**Key Features:**
- **Intuitive Interface:** An easy-to-navigate platform that makes data exploration enjoyable.
- **Powerful Charts and Embeds:** Bring together various data tools and presents the insights with beautiful visualizations.
- **Jedi AI (Beta):** Assists users by generating insights while navigating data challenges.
- **Community and Resources:** Engages users through a rich ecosystem of templates, community-shared ideas, and resources such as the Smooth Operators Guide podcast.

**Website and Resources:**  
To dive deeper into what Livedocs offers, visit their [website](https://livedocs.com), read their [blog](https://livedocs.com/<https:/livedocs.com/blog>), or explore their documentation and community guides. 

In a world where data is both a blessing and a cloud of confusion, Livedocs sheds light, making it easy for any modern team to become data-driven storytellers. Time to get your data superpowers!
